author: Emma Munbodh
title: 6 hacks to find cheap last minute holiday deals to Spain, Greece and Europe
text:
Spain and Greece are some of the most popular go-to destinations for British holiday-makers seeking cheap late getaways, family escapes and city breaks - and with temperatures rarely below 25-degrees - you're guaranteed to get your sun fix.
If you're looking for a cheap package deal or flight to the Mediterranean, and aren't quite ure where to start, take a look below for our top 6 hacks on how to find the best last minute holiday deals .
For more holiday hacks, see our cruise deals page or our guide on how to find a Disneyland package on a budget . If you're going all inclusive, here are some tips to get you started .
1. For cheap on-the-day flights Compare prices using a website like Skyscanner to narrow down prices
If you're after a same-day flight, Tripadvisor has a handy 'lowest fares' section on their flights page with the cheapest flights of the day to Europe. Fares start at around £16 return.
easyJet 's cheap flights page lists the best last minute flight prices to 33 European destinations including Spain, Turkey and France. Enter your destination and key dates to see what the lowest fares for you are.
Expedia's 'Travel Tonight' section lists the best package holidays for those travelling on-the-day, and prices start at £38 a night. The downside is that many of these depart from London only.
2. For flights this week Expedia's 'Travel this week' section lists their best package breaks each week with return fares to Europe across a number of budget and luxury airlines.
Lastminute.com is also a trusted source for late deals. The website covers flights , package breaks, all inclusive holidays and city breaks. For the best prices, see their seasonal reductions page which lists the best offers all year round.
Lastminute.com currently also has a 50% off Barcelona hotels sale.
3. For holiday inspiration on a budget Going somewhere hot? Widen your options
Instead of just keeping your dates flexible, why not keep open-minded about where you're going too?
Holiday comparison site Skyscanner has an "everywhere" destinations option. Use this tool to see which places are cheapest to visit on your chosen dates.
British Airways' late deals page lists their best last minute package deals going in Europe and further afield. Browse the list for a holiday that suits your budget.
Another site to keep an eye on is Monarch Airlines as they list their best 10 late offers every week here .
4. For cheap hotels There are a number of websites that are handy for finding accomodation deals, as well as holiday rental sites like AirBnB . Some websites to check out include:
Lastminute villas
Tripadvisor's top 25 hotels, including best hotels on a budget, and best experience
Tripadvisor's holiday rentals page
Monarch Airlines' hotels from £1 a night
5. For cheap all inclusive breaks For a guaranteed stress-free break, you can go all inclusive. See the best all-inclusive deals here .
Thomas Cook's package deals page is update daily, and lists the best deals going last minute - prices start at around £400 per person.
There's also a handy guide on lastminute.com which lists the best late all-inclusive deals of the week, so you can take your pick of the packages.
6. For cheap family breaks Camping Les Pins Eurocamp's family breaks start at around £18 a night
If you're after a cheap summer holiday or half term break, Eurocamp is a good place to start. Similar to Butlin's and Legoland , the camping specialists offer breaks across Europe from £7 per person, per night. For the best deals, book two-months in advance.
You can view Eurocamp's best late deals here . The best packages are often to France or Spain. Flights are NOT included, however, you can use a budget airline or a ferry to cross the channel, with prices from £39 with P&O Ferries.
